name: places/ChIJO4_t_gX2wokRbAlS5Ba6-Qk
formattedAddress: 1870 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1870 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029-2046, USA

originalText.text: It's under a new name now.  The inside is small- not enough room for clients. The acrylic they use is insanely strong.  I had a mask on, plus my scarf covering to my nose and I was still gaging on the fumes.  The nail tech did not speak a word of english- only Spanish, sh she had to continuously call over another co-worker to translate.  She also nicked me with the clippers and tried to hide it !  She had her hand covering her work the entire process.  I had to use Google Translate to ask for alcohol after she didn't take the initiative to do it herself. Go somewhere else safer where you can communicate with the staff.

originalText.text: Amy was super rude, unprofessional and didn’t sanitize any tools. Got my feet done here on Friday they did such a horrible job that by Monday I had to go somewhere else to get them done correctly. I will never go back here and I don’t recommend anyone go here either

originalText.text: I come her all the time and once I got my nails done here and the guy was shoving the same brush he was putting my acrylics on into his ear to clean out his ear and every time I get my nails done here my skin is left peeling and they DONT  clean your nails before putting on acrylics

originalText.text: I get my nails done right when I go there but  sometimes you may have to wait for a little while but it is always worth it. And the prices are not bad
